column1: Moshi has a tropical wet and dry climate. Its weather is dominated year round by monsoonal flow. column3: shallow (averaging only 2 kilometres or 1.2 miles in depth)
column4: and capped by inversion and dry
column5: subsiding air. These factors result in light or insignificant rainfall year-round except during the transitional periods between the monsoons.Moshi's altitude keeps temperatures lower than surrounding cities
column6: even without the maritime effects that a coastal city enjoys. Nighttime temperatures are relatively consistent throughout the year
